title: Blubber
subtitle: A yml builder for wikibase-docker
prolog_description:
Blubber is a tool, which is supposed to setup your wikibase based on Docker in easy way.

Docker is kind of virtualisation, which encapsulate components or services inside containers. You can get more informations here.

If you want to setup docker now you can use this link.

Also you will need Docker-Composer, which is included in the Docker community edition, so most likely you won't need to install it separately. You can find Docker-Composer here.

You can run the whole setup or use directly the default settings:
invalid_port_integer: The given portnumber is not a valid integer
is_well_known_port: The given port is a well known port
port_is_in_use: The given port is allready in use
invalid_string: Only non empty strings are allowed
invalid_step: You have to use at least one container
generalSettings_question: Which containers you want to install?
expertMode: Do you want to take the default settings?
mediawikiSiteName: How would you like to name your MediaWiki?
mediawikiAdminName: How would you like to name your MediaWiki admin account?
mediawikiAdminPassword: Provide your admin account a password.
databaseAlias: How you like to name the Wikibase container localy?
databasePort: Which port the database should use?
databaseName: How you like to name the database?
databaseUser: What is the name of your database user?
databaseUserPassword: Provide your database user a password.
wikibaseAlias: How you like to name the Wikibase container localy?
elasticsearch_description: Elasticsearch is vectorspace-model based search engine, which is used by wikibase. You can get more informations here.
elasticsearchAlias: How you like to name the Elasticsearch container localy?
wikibaseQuickstatements_description: QuickStatements is a tool to batch-edit Wikidata. You can take a look here.
wikibaseQuickstatementsAlias: How you like to name the Quickstatements container localy?
wikibaseQuickstatementsNamespaceProperty: Which namespace you want to use for properties in Wikibase?
wikibaseQuickstatementsNamespaceItem: Which namespace you want to use for items in Wikibase?
wikibaseQuickstatementsPrefixProperty: Which prefix you want to use for properties in Wikibase?
wikibaseQuickstatementsPrefixItem: Which prefix you want to use for items in Wikibase?
wikibaseBlazegraph_description: Blazegraph is the backend for the SPARQL query service (WDQS).
wikibaseBlazegraphAlias: How you like to name the SPARQL query service (WDQS) container localy?
wikibaseBlazegraphPort: Which port the SPARQL query service should use?
wikibaseProxy_description: The Proxy is supposed to make the query service READONLY. Also he should enforce query timeouts.
wikibaseProxyAlias: How you like to name the proxy service?
wikibaseProxyPort: Which port the proxy service should use?
wikibaseFrontend_description: The User Interface for WDQS is a frontend for the SPARQL query service.
wikibaseFrontendAlias: How you like to name the User Interface for WDQS container localy?
wikibaseFrontendPort: Which port the User Interface for WDQS should use?
wikibaseUpdaterAlias: How you like to name the update service?
complete_description: You can download the generated yml file by clicking on download.
showBeforeDownloadYml: Show me the generated yml file
